post.description: Returns an object containing various details about a specific account on the blockchain.

parent.description: The parent of this permission, if any

post.description: Returns an object containing various details about a specific block on the blockchain.

block_num_or_id.description: Provide a `block number` or a `block id`

transactions.description: list of valid transaction receipts included in block

status.description:
status:
  * `executed` - Succeed, no error handler executed
  * `soft_fail` - Objectively failed (not executed), error handler executed
  * `hard_fail` - Objectively failed and error handler objectively failed thus no state change
  * `delayed` - Transaction delayed/deferred/scheduled for future execution
  * `expired` - Transaction expired and storage space refuned to user

ref_block_prefix.description: lower 32 bits of block ID; used to prevent replay attacks

post.description: Returns an object containing various details about the blockchain.

server_version.description: Hash representing the last commit in the tagged release

chain_id.description: Hash representing the ID of the chain

head_block_num.description: Highest block number on the chain

head_block_id.description: Highest block ID on the chain

head_block_producer.description: Producer that signed the highest block (head block)

last_irreversible_block_num.description: Highest block number on the chain that has been irreversibly applied to state

last_irreversible_block_id.description: Highest block ID on the chain that has been irreversibly applied to state

virtual_block_cpu_limit.description: CPU limit calculated after each block is produced, approximately 1000 times block_cpu_limit

virtual_block_net_limit.description: NET limit calculated after each block is produced, approximately 1000 times block_net_limit

server_version_string.description: String representation of server version - Majorish-Minorish-Patchy - Warning - Not actually SEMVER!

fork_db_head_block_num.description: Sequential block number representing the best known head in the fork database tree

fork_db_head_block_id.description: Hash representing the best known head in the fork database tree

post.description: This method expects a transaction in JSON format and will attempt to apply it to the blockchain.

signatures.description: array of signatures required to authorize transaction

items.description: String representation of an EOSIO compatible cryptographic signature
items.title: Signature

post.description: This method expects a transaction in JSON format and will attempt to apply it to the blockchain.

signatures.description: array of signatures required to authorize transaction

post.description: This method expects a transaction in JSON format and will attempt to apply it to the blockchain.

expiration.description: Time that transaction must be confirmed by.
expiration.title: DateTime

post.description: Retrieves the glock header state

block_num_or_id.description: Provide a block_number or a block_id

post.description: Retrieves the ABI for a contract based on its account name

anyOf.description: String representation of privileged EOSIO name type
anyOf.title: NamePrivileged

anyOf.description: String representation of basic EOSIO name type, must be 12 characters and contain only a-z and 0-5
anyOf.title: NameBasic

anyOf.description: String representation of EOSIO bid name type, 1-12 characters and only a-z and 0-5 are allowed
anyOf.title: NameBid

anyOf.description: String representation of EOSIO name type
anyOf.title: NameCatchAll

post.description: Retrieves the current balance

items.description: A string representation of an EOSIO symbol, composed of a float with a precision of 4, and a symbol composed of capital letters between 1-7 letters separated by a space, example `1.0000 ABC`.
items.title: Symbol

post.description: Retrieves currency stats

schema.description: Returns an object with one member labeled as the symbol you requested, the object has three members: supply (Symbol), max_supply (Symbol) and issuer (Name)

post.description: Returns the required keys needed to sign a transaction.

items.description: String representation of EOSIO public key type
items.title: PublicKey

post.description: Retrieves producers list

limit.description: total number of producers to retrieve

lower_bound.description: In conjunction with limit can be used to paginate through the results. For example, limit=10 and lower_bound=10 would be page 2

post.description: Retrieves raw code and ABI for a contract based on account name
Retrieves the scheduled transaction

lower_bound.description: Date/time string in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sss
lower_bound.title: DateTimeSeconds

limit.description: The maximum number of transactions to return

json.description: true/false whether the packed transaction is converted to json

post.description: Retrieves table scope

code.description: `name` of the contract to return table data for

lower_bound.description: Filters results to return the first element that is not less than provided value in set

upper_bound.description: Filters results to return the first element that is greater than provided value in set

reverse.description: Reverse the order of returned results

post.description: Returns an object containing rows from the specified table.

code.description: The name of the smart contract that controls the provided table

table.description: The name of the table to query

scope.description: The account to which this data belongs

index_position.description: Position of the index used, accepted parameters `primary`, `secondary`, `tertiary`, `fourth`, `fifth`, `sixth`, `seventh`, `eighth`, `ninth` , `tenth`

key_type.description: Type of key specified by index_position (for example - `uint64_t` or `name`)

post.description: Returns an object containing rows from the specified table.
Returns an object containing rows from the specified table.
Returns an object containing rows from the specified table.
Returns an object containing rows from the specified table.
Retreives the activated protocol features for producer node

params.description: Defines the filters to retreive the protocol features by

search_by_block_num.description: Flag to indicate it is has to search by block number

reverse.description: Flag to indicate it has to search in reverse

activated_protocol_features.description: Variant type, an array of strings with the activated protocol features

more.description: In case there's more activated protocol features than the input parameter `limit` requested, returns the ordinal of the next activated protocol feature which was not returned, otherwise zero.
